markdownRemark.html:
I wanted to write a personal shitblog. So, whereâ€™s the start? From blog hostings, of course. But thatâ€™s not for Jedi. I want MY OWN blog with my own domain name. Denied. Further, sure, Wordpress. Tried all of this under the light of the LAMP: chosen the theme, installed some plugins. Need a hosting. And here I understood that I donâ€™t want to pay â€™cause Iâ€™m poor. And I started looking for a freeway.

I invented some ways: free hosting or on my own PC. Free hostings scared my paranoia. LAMP remote setup on my own PC was to difficult for me. And I found in Google that I can use GitHub as a hosting. And gallopedâ€¦ Static site generator Jekyll was googled. Tried. Beautiful, free, but difficult. Letâ€™s google againâ€¦ And I found Octopress, Ruhoh, Hexo as special static site generators for blogs. Letâ€™s roll.

Ruhoh seemed complicated to me againâ€‰â€“â€‰too little wallpapers themes. Hexoâ€‰â€“â€‰I had problems with Node.js on my OS (probably problems with /dev/hands). I choosed Octopress as a result. Many plugins out of the box and good default theme with huge amount community themes and plugins.

So, free hosting on GitHub (and all benefits from this huge project), beautiful HTML5 + CSS3 website, fast and reliable â€™cause of its static nature.
